security: This document contains references to Top Secret information related to CIA activities, assassination files, and intelligence operations, as indicated by the classification markings and file contents. Releasing details about these files could reveal sensitive operational methods, intelligence sources, and classified relationships with other agencies, potentially harming national security. Quoting directly: "All folders are no compartingfted files in Codeword safe word found in the copies." and "Each file contains access list, agenda and minutes".
summary: This is an inventory of Rockefeller Commission files from June 1975, detailing the contents and file codes of documents related to the CIA's activities, the Kennedy assassination, and other sensitive matters.
summary_one_paragraph: An inventory document from the Rockefeller Commission, dated June 1975, lists the contents and file codes of various documents, including correspondence, memos, reports, and depositions related to CIA activities within the United States, the Kennedy assassination, and other sensitive investigations. The inventory, which spans 263 pages, categorizes files by the legal teams responsible for different chapters of the Commission's report, such as those focusing on Watergate, domestic intelligence, mail intercepts, and CIA assistance to state and local agencies, including the Office of Security and the Directorate of Science and Technology.
title: Inventory of Rockefeller Commission Files
